content: Extension of expiring provisions administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs. The text chunk discusses amendments to various sections of title 38, United States Code, extending deadlines for different programs related to health care, grant assistance, treatment, and rehabilitation for homeless and mentally ill veterans until December 31, 2007. Amendments to title 38, United States Code extend deadlines for programs related to health care, grant assistance, treatment, and rehabilitation for homeless and mentally ill veterans until December 31, 2007. Expansion of eligibility for survivors' and dependents' educational assistance program. Expansion of eligibility for survivors' and dependents' educational assistance program by amending Section 3501(a)(1) of title 38, United States Code to include the spouse or child of a member of the Armed Forces with a total disability permanent in nature incurred or aggravated in the active military, naval, or air service. The text chunk discusses amendments to Section 3511 of title 38, United States Code, related to eligibility for survivors' and dependents' educational assistance program for individuals with disabilities incurred in military service. The amendments to Section 3511 of title 38, United States Code, expand eligibility for survivors' and dependents' educational assistance program to include individuals with disabilities incurred in military service. This includes eligibility based on the death or disability of a parent or spouse. This includes eligibility based on the death or disability of a parent or spouse. Additionally, the amendments involve changes to specific clauses within the section, such as adding a new clause regarding notification of total disability permanent in nature and updating references to specific subsections within the title. The amendments made to various sections of title 38, United States Code, include expanding eligibility for educational assistance to individuals with disabilities incurred in military service. Changes involve updating specific clauses and references within the sections. The effective date for these amendments applies to educational assistance payments for courses pursued after the enactment of the Act. Passed the House of Representatives on November 14, 2006.
